content.description:
Figure 1. Effect of light intensity (<math alttext="micromoles per square meter per second" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msup><mtext>μmol·m</mtext><mtext>-2</mtext></msup><msup><mtext>·s</mtext><mtext>-1</mtext></msup></math>) on the <math alttext="p H" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of a solution containing algae
Students investigated the effect of light intensity on the rates of photosynthesis and cellular respiration in algae. They placed equal numbers of algal cells into test tubes containing a solution at <math alttext="p H 7.40" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>pH</mi><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>7.40</mn></math>. The test tubes were divided into four treatment groups, and each treatment group was exposed to a different light intensity. The <math alttext="p H" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in the tubes was measured every <math alttext="10" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> minutes and used as an indicator of <math alttext="C O 2" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> concentration because <math alttext="C O 2" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> produces an acidic solution when dissolved in water (Figure 1).
content.question: Based on Figure 1, which of the following environmental changes will result in the greatest increase in the net photosynthetic productivity by the algae?

choices.label: A change in light intensity from <math alttext="0 micromoles per square meter per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mtext>0 μmol·m</mtext><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mtext>·s</mtext><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math> to <math alttext="30 micromoles per square meter per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>30</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.30em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">μ</mi><msup><mtext>mol·m</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mtext>·s</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math>

A change in light intensity from <math alttext="30 micromoles per square meter per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>30</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.30em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">μ</mi><msup><mtext>mol·m</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mtext>·s</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math> to <math alttext="100 micromoles per square meter per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>100</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.30em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">μ</mi><msup><mtext>mol·m</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mtext>·s</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math>

A change in light intensity from <math alttext="100 micromoles per square meter per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>100</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.30em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">μ</mi><msup><mtext>mol·m</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mtext>·s</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math> to <math alttext="200 micromoles per square meter per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>200</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.30em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">μ</mi><msup><mtext>mol·m</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mtext>·s</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math>

A change in light intensity from <math alttext="200 micromoles per square meter per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>200</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.30em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">μ</mi><msup><mtext>mol·m</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mtext>·s</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math> to <math alttext="30 micromoles per square meter per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>30</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.30em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">μ</mi><msup><mtext>mol·m</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mtext>·s</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math>

content.answer: A change in light intensity from <math alttext="0 micromoles per square meter per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mtext>0 μmol·m</mtext><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mtext>·s</mtext><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math> to <math alttext="30 micromoles per square meter per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>30</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.30em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">μ</mi><msup><mtext>mol·m</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mtext>·s</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math>

skill.text: 4.B: Describe data from a table or graph, including: i. identifying specific data points ii. describing trends and patterns in the data iii. describing relationships between variables
